text: Has anyone used the Call Engadgement Search API? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/calls> I can't seem to actually get it to search for properties within the call like hs_call_status or hs_call_body...wondering if that's even possible? <@UD53A9UUR> you're probably at Inbound but IIRC you're the PL for these endpoints?
I can test next week.  On phone right now.  Mind adding your search request body so I can see?
<@UGDF9EBPW>, maybe you could lend a friend a hand :grinning:

I figured it out - it seems like even if you put text in to the call body HubSpot transforms it to HTML:

```"<div style=\"\" dir=\"auto\" data-top-level=\"true\"><p style=\"margin:0;\">cat 123</p></div>"```
So instead of being able to search for EQ cat 123 you have to add the extra HTML
Yell at me next week.  I will ask around
Not yet unfortunately :/ I actually asked one of the Devs this at Inbound yesterday. Hopefully itâ€™s something they could let us extend further!

No worries. It is a frequently asked question on this forum. From earlier: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YHAHB6K/p1689870743403749?thread_ts=1689868740.985979&cid=C2YHAHB6K>

Hello everyone, I would like to consult you, I am currently consulting the api in this way <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts> through postman and it responds well, now what I need is to consult the activities that They are made for each client, could someone tell me what the function is to call this information, thank you very much
